climbs.name: Shin Bashers
climbs.fa: Tony Yaniro, Brett Mauer, Ron Carson 1983

content.description: Climb past a 1/4" bolt with no hanger to the top of Atom Smasher Boulder #3.
content.protection: A wired nut over the one hangerless bolt sort of protects the moves near the ground.
content.location:
This route starts to the left of

Quantum Mechanics

on the NE corner of Atom Smashers Boulder #3.

content.description: This route features great slab climbing on excellent rock but unfortunately the route is on the short side. The bolts are a little spaced but protection is still adequate; if not wanting to lead this route it's easily toproped from the shared anchors with Isotope.
content.location:
Center of the slab just left of

Isotope

.

content.description:
Climb the short, steep face around the corner and left of

Shin Bashers

.
content.location:
This route is on the north end of Atom Smashers Boulder #3, to the left of

Shin Bashers

.

content.description: Layback the right arete of the southermost Atom Smasher boulder. Two bolts and then run it to the top (the difficulty eases soon after the second bolt). Two bolt lower off.

This excellent route climbs the southwest arete of a giant boulder on high-quality stone. Not really a sport route, but reasonably well-protected with technical and balancy moves up an arete that steepens and curves right near the top. A progressive route back when it was first done this is still a worthy tick if in the area.

Begin on the NW side of Boulder II. Stem off an adjacent boulder and make balancy moves to the first of four bolts. Veer right to a second bolt to gain a dihedral. Clip two more bolts before leaving the dihedral to a featured face. Run it out to the top on the lower angled face.
content.protection: Quickdraws for four bolts protect this fun dihedral / face climb. A bolted anchor is on top.
